headline: Uber Investors Are Calling for More Transparency Into Driver Pay
summary: (Bloomberg) -- A group of investors in Uber Technologies Inc. is calling on the ride-hailing service to disclose more information on how it pays drivers, saying a clearer breakdown is critical to assessing the company’s ability to make money. headline: Darden Restaurants' Diversified Portfolio And Uber Delivery Partnership Offer Confidence In Overcoming Fine Dining Challenges: Analysts
summary: Darden Restaurants, Inc. (NYSE:DRI) shares are trading relatively flat on Friday. Yesterday, the company reported that the second quarter adjusted earnings per share was $2.03, beating the street view of $2.02. Looking ahead, Darden Restaurants said it now sees FY25 total sales of approximately $12.1 billion (prior outlook $11.8 billion – $11.9 billion). It reiterated diluted net earnings per share from continuing operations of $9.40 to $9.60. Following the results, here are the analyst takes on

headline: Why UBER Wins and LYFT Lags as Waymo Shakes Up the Ridesharing Industry
summary: Ridesharing giants Uber Technologies (UBER) and Lyft (LYFT) are facing a new reality as Google-backed Waymo (GOOGL) expands into new markets and General Motors (GM) scraps its self-driving business unit Cruise. Autonomous driving technology is proving to be a revolutionary development that creates both opportunities and challenges for ridesharing companies, and I believe Uber is well-positioned to thrive in the long term compared to Lyft because of its large scale, diversified business operation

headline: Is It Worth Investing in Uber (UBER) Based on Wall Street's Bullish Views?
summary: The average brokerage recommendation (ABR) for Uber (UBER) is equivalent to a Buy. The overly optimistic recommendations of Wall Street analysts make the effectiveness of this highly sought-after metric questionable. So, is it worth buying the stock?

headline: 3 Stocks That Could Turn $1,000 into $5,000 by 2030
summary: Moderna's (NASDAQ: MRNA) market cap currently stands at around $14.8 billion.  To become a five-bagger, the messenger RNA (mRNA) pioneer would need to grow its market cap to $74 billion.  The good news for Moderna is that it's already proven it can reach that level.

headline: More Men Are Addicted to the ‘Crack Cocaine’ of the Stock Market
summary: A new type of addict is showing up at Gamblers Anonymous meetings across the country: investors hooked on the market’s riskiest trades.  At Gamblers Anonymous in the Murray Hill neighborhood of Manhattan, one man called options “the crack cocaine” of the stock market.  Another said he faced hundreds of thousands of dollars in trading losses after borrowing from a loan shark to double down on stocks.
